references.A85CAR01USGP: Carraway, L. N. 1985. Sorex pacificus. Mammalian Species 231: 1-5.

habitat_description: The Pacific Shrew (Sorex pacificus) inhabits moist areas with downed, decaying wood and brushy vegetation.  It has also been found in marshes and wet depressions within California’s redwood, Sequoia, and spruce forests, and in forests burned within 2 years in Oregon.  N. Tarr, 11April2014.
